definition: flat land one could gallop straight across (idiom); wide expanse of flat country
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China

sentences.english: There are one or two hills in Norfolk, but otherwise the landscape is as flat as a pancake.
sentences.chinese: 诺福克有一两座小山丘，但除此之外是一马平川。

sentences.english: Whatever happened, we work high above the ground like a spider.
sentences.chinese: 无论高难险阻，我们的高空作业“蜘蛛人”一马平川。

sentences.english: I like going climbing. That's why I dislike areas that are as flat as a pancake.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢登山，因此我不喜欢一马平川的地方。

definition: as far as the eye can see (idiom)
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
